applicability_reasoning: This regulation applies to the document for several key reasons: 1) The document is from AIB life, which is explicitly stated to be regulated by the Central Bank of Ireland (as noted at the end of the document). 2) The document is a formal pension scheme rules document that requires careful record-keeping and documentation as evidenced by multiple sections referring to administrative requirements, trustee duties, and regulatory compliance. 3) The document contains specific sections about record-keeping requirements, particularly in Section 4 regarding Trustee Duties and Powers where administrative arrangements and documentation requirements are outlined. 4) The document includes requirements for maintaining and providing information to various parties including the Revenue Commissioners, Pensions Authority, and scheme members. Given that this is a regulated financial product document from a regulated entity, it must comply with the Central Bank's requirements for maintaining complete, orderly, accurate and readily accessible records as specified in Regulation 118.
regulation_text: 118. (1) A regulated entity shall maintain complete, orderly, accurate, and readily accessible records. (2) Where the Bank requires a regulated entity to keep a record in respect of the regulated entity's compliance with these Regulations and provide such record to the Bank, the regulated entity is required to provide a record which is complete, orderly and accu rate. (3) For the purposes of paragraph (2), the regulated entity shall provide the record in any period of time and in any format that may be specified by the Bank. Chapter 15 Miscellaneous business requirements
